sanskrit_verse:
कलिः प्रसुप्तो भवति स जाग्रद्द्वापरं युगम् ।
कर्मस्वभ्युद्यतस्त्रेता विचरंस्तु कृतं युगम् ॥ ९.३०२॥
transliteration: kaliḥprasupto bhavati sa jāgraddvāparaṃ yugam | karmasvabhyudyatastretā vicaraṃstu kṛtaṃ yugam || 9.302 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: In Kali Yuga, Dharma sleeps; in Dvapara, it wakes. In Treta, it rises through action; in Krta, it walks fully awake.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from the awakened state of Dharma
Causation aligns with the evolutionary capacity of consciousness
Capacity-based responsibility increases with the clarity of Dharma's expression
Restoration logic operates through progressive awakening, not regression
Consciousness alignment determines the applicability and force of dharma
executable_legal_axioms: ALL adjudications MUST adjust evidentiary thresholds based on dharma_activation_level OF current epoch
supreme_court_application: Supreme Court adjudications shall recognize that the threshold of dharma-based evidence shifts with the epochal activation level. In Kali Yuga, fewer dharma-aligned witnesses or acts may be admissible due to diminished collective capacity. In Krta Yuga, full dharma-consciousness renders even subtle dharmic evidence fully actionable.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality recognizes that epochs reflect stages of collective consciousness evolution. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures sequential unfolding of dharma-awareness. Proportional responsibility is calibrated to the epochal capacity for dharma-recognition. The non-punitive reality rule asserts that misalignment with dharma results in natural consequence, not imposed penalty.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Assign responsibility assumption protocols aligned with individual/collective dharma-readiness
Deploy capacity restoration modules tailored to current epochal dharma_activation_level
Facilitate integrity reintegration via progressive alignment with ascending dharma-states
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as the Source of Law. Dharma is restored through epochal alignment. Justice is non-punitive. Consciousness is the ultimate adjudicator.
